intro: Hieracium stelechodes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, often with a dark center, and bloom from June to August. Hieracium stelechodes is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides.
